Posts.Content: Bless you Jackie as another lady who went into hospital after my first docetaxel cycle I can imagine that you would be petrified for the next cycle. I certainly was. I didn't have the same reaction as you did my problems were with a blood clot on the lung but i think the worry and fear of the next round will have been similar. But all i can say is that you know what to look for, you are prepared and you know that you are one cycle closer to the end. I packed a case and was mentally prepared should the need be to attend hospital again. I was lucky and it wasn't necessary and the last cycle was a breeze. My thoughts are with you xxx
Posts.Title: Just spent 6 days in hospital

Posts.Content: Good morning Diane, I hope my experience may help you also. I had a clot on my lung diagnosed in January 2013. The consultant expects it was caused by the cancer and as a result I was given Fragmin which you inject on a daily basis into your stomach. I had surgery booked for March and my surgeon was happy to carry out my surgery as I was using Fragmin on a daily basis. I stopped the injection the day before surgery and then they gave it to me the following day after my surgery. Good luck with your appointment this afternoon and let us know how you get on warm wishes Louise
Posts.Title: feeling really down now.....

Posts.Content: Hi there, moan all you like hand and foot syndrome is really miserable i have been suffering with it too. I developed in during my first T treatment but at the end of the treatment things do return to normal and you feel like you have new feet. I did have a longer gap between my 3 cycles of T an extra week to recover rather than a reduction in the dosage. My oncology nurses also supplied iced water for my feet and hands whilst I was having the T. I guess this would replicate the cold cap used to prevent hair loss. I did find that this was very useful and did help with the pain. I would also recommend keeping of your feel as much as possible and raising your feet whilst you rest. I know it sounds terribly dull but its amazing what you can accomplish sitting down if you try. I had a stool whilst cooking and sat down to iron. I am sorry it is uncomfortable but I promise things will return to normal. If there is any further please do not hesitate to ask Louise x
Posts.Title: Planter palm etc.

Posts.Content: HI Andrey, I am sure you must feel pretty helpless being on the other side of the world and your mother in law obviously suffering. I am afraid I have no experience in the area at all but perhaps if you called the Macmillan help line they could offer you some advise. It sounds as if quick medical intervention is required. Is she registered with a Dr in her home town could you make contact with them and ask them to call on her? or make an appointment on her behalf? Seems like speed might be most important to consider and she may feel too unwell to travel at this time. Good luck and I hope others can offer you some further advise Warm wishes Louise
Posts.Title: What to do ... my mother in law

Posts.Content: Hi Tina Rose, I also have inflammatory breast cancer disgnosed in October 2012. after treatment my breast cancer has reoccured. This has meant a new series of CT and MRI scans have been taken and I have asked at each results meeting to see the scansÂ  ( which can be shared on their computer screens). I have never had any problem when asking to see these scans after all they are of my body and to ask in detail about their findings which include a report of the findings too. I have also asked for copies which I have taken to the Royal Marsden Hospital for second opinions without any problems too. I would suggest that you phone ahead of your next scheduled appointment and say that you would like to see these records so that they can prepare them ahead of schedule and share them with you. If it helps take someone with you to make notes so that you can re read them when you get home too. I do know that you are protected under the Data Protection Act 1998 and you have personal rights to see anything that is recorded about yourself either on a computer or on paper but hopefully you will not have to mention this. Please feel free to contact me it would be good to speak to someone else with the same diagnosis. Much love Louise x
Posts.Title: I want to look at my scans and other tests

Posts.Content: Hi there I took C & L for about 6 months at the end of and start of 2014 and due to the side effects I experienced have since joined a trial on TBM1. The side effects included hand and foot syndrome, tiredness, breathlessness when climbing the stairs, but I did manage to take it for 6 months as the long term effects of preventing the cancer spreading to other areas of my body from my inflammatory breast cancer. I suggest you make a note of all the effects you think are occurring and feed them back to the oncologist at your next meeting. I found the treatment harsh but doable but then I'm 48 years old and not the age of your mum. Good luck xxx
Posts.Title: Advice on effectiveness of Capecitabine & Lapatinib please

Posts.Content: No worries Tina i answer to either name :) Keep strong and all the very best to you xxx
Posts.Title: I want to look at my scans and other tests

Posts.Content: And you thought after the roller coaster you were on the easy ride. Sometimes it doesn't seem to end does it?. I liken it to driving a car sometimes the BC is my front seat passenger sometimes I manage to get him in the back seat and sometimes even in the boot but he is still riding with me. Good luck with your biopsy I hope its nothing more than just a lump Louise x
Posts.Title: I don't believe it

Posts.Content: Hi Sim sorry you have had to join the club but it is blessed with lots of help and support for all people that need it. It will take time for the news to sink in,do not worry, there is no time limit its the body's way of coping. I have had chemo followed by surgery but there are lots of ladies that will be having or had their treatment in the same order as yourself. I found my BC nurse was a great source of information and support during the early stages of my diagnosis. Take care xxx
Posts.Title: New to group

Posts.Content: Hi Alison, I will be returning to work in the not too distant future and I have been wondering how I would know when I was ready to do so. I think if you are shattered your body is telling you that it is too soon. Not sure what sort of work it is that you do but I am thinking of a gradual return eg a few hours building upwards to my full time position. Good employers will wait for good employees to be fit and ready for work so I think you should listen to your body and do what is best for you. Good luck and take it easy xx
Posts.Title: Going back to work

Posts.Content: Glad to hear you are home Marg. I hope all is going well for your recovery and most of all you are comfy xxx
Posts.Title: op day tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi Marg, wishing you the very best of luck for tomorrow. A few things I found helpful to pack were Front opening nighty, a few cartons of juice, some chocolate (hopefully friends/family will bring more!) some sucky sweets to help with thirst, favorite pillow/ blanket/cuddly to make you comfy. Hope you are keeping busy today, please ensure that you accept any offers of help for cooking and cleaning when you come home. Lots of love to you Marg Louise x
Posts.Title: op day tomorrow

Posts.Content: Dear I will beat this, its normal to be scared and your body is justÂ  showing you what you need right now. If 2 pieces of toast is enough then just have 2 pieces of toast. I found mashed banana comforting and a glass of milk but just choose what you fancy. All people respond differently to chemo so please don't be worried about some of the experiences you read on this site, we are all different and we all have our own individual bodies. It is doable. I hope the chemo is kind to you I always tried to think of it as a friend rather than a foe after all it will help you in the long term........ I hope that your chemo is kind to you and in the words of Charlie and the chocolate factory's Violet Bodegard "Keep your eyes on the prize" Warm wishes Louise
Posts.Title: Chemo tomorrow

Posts.Content: Yesterday I had an ECG I have had 5 since I have been diagnosed and have always been treated with dignity but when I left yesterday's appointment I felt uncomfortable and tearful. Previous ECG. Exams have been carried out by male nurses but yesterdays was female in the past I have had a gown which is left undone at the front and the nurse used it to keep my right breast covered whilst the probe is used on the left side with a cold gel to manoeuvre over and take the necessary readings. I was not given a gown or anything like a towel to cover myself up with. It was painful where she pressed hard on my chest which she never warmed me about or checked I was ok with. She didn't explain what she was doing and before I had even dreamt of asking her the results of the scan she barked at me the results would be sent to my Consultant so not to ask her. She then left the room instructing me I was free to leave once I was dressed. I honestly Left feeling like a piece of meat that had been prodded and poked rather than looked after and cared for. And a day later I still feel upset :(
Posts.Title: ECG feel exposed

Posts.Content: Thank you for your replies I appreciate it. I feel much better today but will make contact with PALS as it might help others who meet this individual and perhaps needs some additional training. In the world of all the wonderful caring people I have met it's just a Small pimple on my journey but I do feel better for sharing my experience. Thanks again xx
Posts.Title: ECG feel exposed

Posts.Content: Hi Joan 1066, my underarm seemed swollen after my mastectomy in March this year. I found that after I had done the daily exercise it felt swollen and during the day it seemed to subside and then the same the next day. I mentioned it to my BC nurse too and she checked that it wasn't a collection of fluid, which it wasn'tÂ  I then went on to have my radiotherapy and it seem to take my mind off it. I would think if you are concerned still mention it to your surgeon at your next meeting maybe or ask your BC nurse to have a good look at it. Hope that help to reassure you Louise x
Posts.Title: swelling underarm

Posts.Content: Hi Beckylindsay9, ibruprofin is a muscle relaxant which would help stiff muscles in the neck along with very gentle heat from one of those heat pads or a well wrapped hot water bottle with very gentle stretching movements. I hope it feels better soon that always has helped me xxx
Posts.Title: Sentinel node

Posts.Content: Thank you for replying to my post each of you. I feel more reassured now and will follow this up on Tuesday when I have an appointment to see the chemo nurses about the start of my new chemo.I had not considered cording and I am not sure how they treat that but I am sure itÂ  will do able. G&J they call me lucky Louise in my family of course tongue in cheek ;-) I like the idea of TDM1 being lots of treats. I'm a plain chocolate kind of gal and am rather partial to a caramac too. Love to all Louise xxx
Posts.Title: pain running down inside of arm

Posts.Content: Hi there, I am waiting for TDM1 chemotherapy treatment for re occuring inflammatory breast cancer and last week I had a red rash appear on the inside of the topÂ  of my arm. I am not currently taking any medication. I showed it to the chemo nurse on Wednesday this week and she gave me a barrier cream to put on it. Today the redness has reduced in the rash but the pain has spread down my arm to above my elbow but as the day has worn on its now trailing down the inside of my arm and into my thumb. The area is not swollen to look at although it does feel heavy. I have been really active doing some house work and gardening but even so this doesn't feel like a sprain or strain. I am wondering if this is Lymphodema and whether its something I should have checked out urgently.? any advise or suggestions would be very welcome please. Thanks so much I tried the maccy line but i was too late in the day to speak to one of the nurses :( Louise xxx
Posts.Title: pain running down inside of arm

Posts.Content: Glad you are not too bad at the moment. Believe me the time will go very fast and in the words from Charlie and the chocolate factory - "keep your eyes on the prize" xxx
Posts.Title: 2 days into chemo.........

Posts.Content: Hi Busy mum sorry you find yourself here on the site no one wants to join, however there are lots of wonderful people whom will be delighted to support and share their experiences with you. Over the last week there have been lots of ladies beginning chemo before xmas and into the new year I am sure one of them will contact you shortly. What sort of chemo are you having FEC(T)? wishing you love and light Louise x ...
Posts.Title: 2 days into chemo.........

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy, i have had a similar experience too. People do treat you different when you have or have had cancer don't they. No matter how hard you try you have changed too and I think for me it put my work into a different prospective. Please remember you are covered by the Disability Act and if you speak to the lovely people here at macland they will be able to send you a booklet ( or you can down load it). It does help to know your rights. My reporting line changed when I went back to work and within a very small company this did change things considerably for me and how i felt about the company. Remember you are your own person with your own needs which must be your priority now, you must put yourself first and find a way forward that suits you and not your company. Maybe its time to move on? Thinking of you xxx
Posts.Title: returning to work and it isn't the same

Posts.Content: Thanks for sharing I think a bit of retail therapy is on the cards !
Posts.Title: ASDA post surgery bras

Posts.Content: Hi Daisydot, I felt for you when I read your post especially after the wait you have had. Keep positive and take the strength you have already got forward to form part of your next course of treatment. We are all here with you on your journey wishing you lots of love
Posts.Title: Second time around? Results tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi M65 thank you I did get your private message and I thought I would reply to you on the open forum too. I am sorry you sound a bit disappointed about your surgery results but it is early days perhaps given a bit more time things will settle down and you will be happier? Let me know what day your oncolgist appointment is so I can also wish you the best of luck. Thanks for your good wishes for today. I am setting off soon. All the best xx
Posts.Title: Message for Aroma mum

Posts.Content: Hi Only Me sounds like we are at the same stages in our hair growth. My hair is lovely and soft and I am so pleased it is growing back. I will be reading the posts with interest. I don't think I could bare to have it shaved after getting this far. Good luck to you Louise x
Posts.Title: Hair Regrowth

Posts.Content: Hi Karen, Firstly well done for putting your concerns out there. I think you already know the answer yourself and that you need to check things out as soon as possible and all I can say to you is that you are important and that if you are in pain,it is not right to carry on. You do not say if you had radiotherapy as part of your treatment in June 2013 but it is often the case that the treatment can leave a painful/ discomport in the area but even so it is worth getting it checked out. So that you can put your mind at ease. First port of call is your Dr tomorrow morning, you are important and need to look after yourself as if you are your own best friend. Hope all is ok and please let us know how you get on Much Love Louise x
Posts.Title: please help

Posts.Content: Yes I understand that. Once your treatment is completed you do feel very alone and the mental support that you need is not so visible to those around you. Do you still have contact with your BC nurse? I spent some time at the end of my treatment the first time around talking to the Macmillan support team at my hospital and also on the phone. It helped me. I do hope your pain subsides over the coming days is it a stabbing pain or a dull ache?
Posts.Title: please help

Posts.Content: Karen that sounds very uncomfortable for you. Have you talked to your lovely sisters perhaps one of them could go with you to the Drs? My sister has been fantastic but like you say no one can walk in your shoes. I know that others on this site would urge you to have it checked out and it's difficult to pluck up the courage by yourself sometimes. Please look after yourself. My inflammatory cancer of the breast did return and on reflection I was glad that I had gone back because of the smallest patch of redness in my breast. I like you didn't want to make a fuss but I have children who rely on me to be the most well I can be so that I can take good care of them. I truly admire the young men they are becoming and I know that my experience and talking about it openly will perhaps help them in someway in later life. Much love x
Posts.Title: please help

Posts.Content: Hi Karen, Bless you are you frightened? Please PM me and we can talk? I think 7 days is long enough if you are in pain Karen and even if its nothing you will have your mind put at rest at the end of it. Louise x
Posts.Title: please help

Posts.Content: HI there, I am a bit down at the moment but I always feel better after talking to others on the Maccy website. I am currently undergoing oral chemotherapy. Its a 3 week cycle 2 weeks of the oral chemo and the 3rd week the pain comes back but I am chemo free! The pain can make me very grumpy :(
Posts.Title: please help

Posts.Content: Hi ASB I am sorry to read about your diagnosis and your conversation with your Onc. I have been receiving Docetaxol at the same time as herceptin and its had its tough days believe me. I am keeping myself going by planning a warm holiday somewhere with my two boys later in the summer. It is very difficult to agree or disagree with others decisions about treatment as we are all so individual With our own thought and situations. I do know with my own decisions initially I thought I would never agree To having radiotherapy. But now I have changed my mind after reading others experiences on this site and The desire to have as much of a life as possible with my boys and wonderful partner. You may find you have A change of heart and you may not. That is your choice. I wish you a wonderful holiday and keep in touch with your Journey ahead.
Posts.Title: Postponing more chemo...have I made right decision?

Posts.Content: HelloÂ  I saw the oncologist today as I had a new red patch occur on my reconstructed breast. I also have a new rash on the inside of my arm on the same side. Onc has suggested a new CT scan ( only had one last month) but expect that the capcitabiine and the lapatanib may have stopped working for me and it may suggest I can trial this new drug called TDM1. I just wondered if there was anyone out there trialing this new drug and whether anyone had has the same experience. I suspect skin mets but this hasn't been mentioned yet by my onc. I presume for skin mets they would do a biopsy? If anyone can help with their own experiences I would be very grateful Louise x
Posts.Title: INFLAMMATORY BREAST CANCER NEW REDNESS

Posts.Content: Hi After chemotherapy in 2011/12 my periods stopped. In fact after the first treatment. I have completed chemo, mx, rads partial herceptin treament. Then after being re diagnosed I am now taking lapatanib and an oral chemotherapy drug. Today 15 months later and at the age of 47 i have had what I can only describe as a period. I thought these would have stopped forever and although I am pleased ( i know odd isn't it but somehow is making me feel like a lady!)Â  I am a bit worried that this is not normal. I have an appointment with my oncologist next week and will be mentioning it to him then but in the meantime have any other of your ladies experienced this? I would be grateful for any comments. Thanks Louise
Posts.Title: periods!

Posts.Content: Hi mother of two sometimes we all need to have a moment of melt down especially after a busy day like you had. Take the afternoon off do something for yourself reading a film tv something to keep you occupied. Ask a good friend around. Talking does help and although I don't have the answers you are searching for I can tell you that you are not alone and there are lots of us outhere hoping that your news will be good news. Having breast cancer and a family is hard work. I have two boys too but I wouldn't have it any other way. Big cyber hugs your way xxx
Posts.Title: whats next help heads had it

Posts.Content: Hi Edie, that sounds very positive news with your current treatment I hope it continues to help you keep some sort of balance between the up and down days. I am glad you have extra support from cares coming in. Many of use come here to let of steam, vent our anger and obtain support each of us comes with their own story and pathology but the good will for other human beings is always here. Embracing you with soft hugs Louise x
Posts.Title: Breast cancer with lung liver and bones secondaries

Posts.Content: Hi Maria, Of course, you would be worried, people do say the strangest things! I didn't know what LCIS was to be honest so I have just read the section on the Macy website. I am not sure if you have already done that yourself. It does set out all of the facts very well and reads about the importance of regular mamo's, self examination and breast exams. I had some time with my nurse at my Drs surgery showing me how to examine myself correctly and feel more confident about doing that now. If I am honest I worry about the return of cancer often but I have now managed to move it from the front passanger seat in my imaginary car and put it in the back seat and hope that one day it will move into the boot! I am sure other ladies will be able to share their own experiences with you Wishing you a big hug x
Posts.Title: LCIS

Posts.Content: Anne-Marie, what a wonderful post. I hope you have a fabulous time at the park with your son. After being diagnosed with cancer sometimes the smallest of things bring you the most pleasure. I sat outside last Saturday night with my two teenage boys with a BBQ and some music. we may have spend no longer than an hour talking laughing and eating, but to me it was precious. Big hugs Louise
Posts.Title: For anyone about to start or going through chemo.....

Posts.Content: Whoop whoop great news and good luck with your work return. Hope you keep up the feelings of euphoria xx
Posts.Title: I did it!!!

Posts.Content: Hi there, I am currently having oral chemo with thorasic surgery likely at the end of the treatment in February 2014. I have inflammatory breast cancer which returned after MX in March 2013. Warm wishes Louise x
Posts.Title: Recurrence loco regional

Posts.Content: Hi just asking I am so sorry to hear how awful you are feeling, bless you I can assure you I have had days where I thought I couldn't go on but I did! And as you know already you come through the other side although a different person to your previous life. You don't mention which meds you are taking but there are some excellent pain relievers out there for you to insist upon. The nurses on this sight are brilliant with pain relief suggestions when I have called them and I suggest you pick up the phone to your breast care nurse first thing tomorrow and demand some help. No one deserves to feel so awful and there is do much help out there to grab onto. I am sending you a very gentle hug xxx
Posts.Title: unbearable pain

Posts.Content: Hi Mary whilst I am not medically trained if your body responds to the penicillin it does seem as if the redness is an infection. However I would be inclined to get it looked at by your GP to be sure. Wishing you all the best Louise
Posts.Title: Has anyone had the same experience?

Posts.Content: Hi Squirrel my cancerÂ  returned in September this year after completing my radsÂ  in June. I have been taking capcitabine and am currently on cycle number 3 ( started again oral chemo on Boxing day :(Â  I have found that my hair has continued to grow on this medication and so i have been told it does not effect your hair growth. I was so delighted that I have risked a haircut!. I had the same look as you described but wasn't sure if it was due to using the cold cap for a couple of my FEC_T chemo's. Don't give up on your hair you may find that in a couple of months small downy hair starts to grow and you will be delighted. I look forward to hearing from you again. By the way how do you cope with the sore feet my toes are so painful its really miserable. Much love Louise x
Posts.Title: still bald on top, feeling sad

Posts.Content: Cor many congratulations on the birth of your new girls, what wonderful news. I think its important to have any changes to your mx scares checked out asap but as you say it may be quite normal as so many changes happen to your breasts as your milk comes etc etc after a new baby(s). I am sure it must a very exhausting time for you ( i bet that is an understatement) so I hope you are able to focus on your girls whilst you are waiting to be seen on Monday and keep busy. Good luck and please post and let us know how you get on Louise x
Posts.Title: New thickening next to mastectomy scar :(

Posts.Content: Hello, I have not personally had Gemcarbo chemo but I did meet a lady who was having that treatment whilst i was in the chomo ward. My understanding was that it was a mixture of two drugs and that the side effects were similar to other chemotherapy treatments. I hope someone else can share with you more information. I wish you all the best with your treatment with love xxx
Posts.Title: Gemcarbo

Posts.Content: Hi Emma, I had a single mx and left side node clearance this time last year. It does take time to feel less sore but it does happen I promise. Everyday it becomes a little bit easier but until then I hope you have some good painkillers to help you to manage the pain. Don't suffer without pain relief there are no medals for it !. Have you a good network of support and have they offered to help with some tasks? take them up on it, really you should be doing nothing but taking care of yourself and doing your excercises. I imagine you are still very tired from your op too. So get out that crunchie and put your feet up Emma. Much love Louise xxx
Posts.Title: 2 weeks on. Still just as sore

Posts.Content: HI Marg, i found that my eyes were sensitive after chemo too especially in the winter months. I also used a soothing eye drop that I purchased over the counter and this helped very quickly to restore my eyes to comfort. I would also suggest an updated eye test when you feel up to it as I understand sometimes the chemo drugs can have an effect on the vision. Hope all goes well Louise
Posts.Title: lashes

Posts.Content: Hi there my cold cap experience was without success. However I am Glad I tried it as I would have always wondered. Good luck with your trials xxx
Posts.Title: cold cap??

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies , this is my first post to the club no one wants to join and I am hoping for some advise. I have my last of 6 chemo treatments coming up on the 18th of Feb. 3 FEC which I was able to do ok with and 2 T which were both a lot more tough. With the last insight and my inflammatory breast cancer reacting so well to the chemo I now have an appointment to meet with the consultant to discuss surgery. How long is it usual between the last chemo and breast surgery ? How should I prepare for such a meeting ? It seems important to take someone with me who can take notes for me but any further comments would be appreciated thanks
Posts.Title: New to the group

Posts.Content: Hello, I am sure that i could contact the lovely Macmillan finance people on the web site but I was interested to know if anyone was able to get a morgage after they had been diagnosed with breast cancer? Thanks for any comments.
Posts.Title: borrowing money

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda, congrats on the second hurdle glad it wasn't too high for you. It does take a while to begin to feel comfortable but nothing better than your own bed to look forward to at the end of the day :) Keep your chin up Louise x
Posts.Title: Second hurdle over :)

Posts.Content: Hi Trina, both of my drains were removed within a week but like Rebecca says it varies from person to person. Why don't you give your BC nurse a ring and speak to her or one of the nurses on this site if you would like reassurance. Good luck and hang on in there Louise x
Posts.Title: Anyone else had their wound drains in for a long time?

Posts.Content: Oh Binny, I am so sorry that is just awful. For me although I am currently in a rented house its been important for me to be somewhere that feels safe and secure during my treatment. I really can not imagine how that must be for you and your husband. My house was on the market when I was diagnosed and sold but by then I only had the energy to move us into a rented house. I have had to spend some of the money from the house move to support my sons and I during my treatment ( i am a widow) but of course now I have spent a chunk of it. Lets hope fresh home means a fresh start of a life that is cancer free............. By the way, staycations are all the rage this year. Good Luck Louise
Posts.Title: borrowing money

Posts.Content: Hi Rebecca, I thought I would add my comments as a mother of two teenage boys and a sufferer of depression myself. My opinion is that talking therapy often helps with depression and in particular cognative behaviour therapy which I was recommended too in the past. I found this personally very helpful and I have always encouraged my boys to speak to others whether its a friend, family member or someone at school (most schools offer counselling today) when things are troubling them. Personally I find that at the age of 13 there are many thoughts and changes happening in the body that feeling out of balance is not uncommon. I do not believe in taking medication as it often covers the symptoms of what your body is trying to tell you and once you stop taking the medication the original feelings can/may return.But that is my personal opinion. Often GP's can see it as a quick answer to a much deeper seated problem. Saying that hopefully your step daughter has a good and sensitive GP and one that will monitor her progress closely. Being a young person today does have different stresses and strains that perhaps we were not exposed to when we were younger. I am sure you offer a good listening ear whilst remaining positive and that will be priceless in the long run All the best Louise xx
Posts.Title: 13 year old given Prozac. Your help.please.

Posts.Content: Sorry what I also meant to say wAs do you have a date for a mamo in the future?
Posts.Title: lump under arm update

Posts.Content: Hi Annech can anyone help with getting you too and from your appointments for the remainder of your radiotherapy? In the end I had a little team who took it in turns to run me to my sessions and luckily they were at the very beginning of the day and so allowed me the rest of the day to put my feet up before organising the evening dinner. Mention it to your team at the hospital they may have some additional help they can suggest too. Plenty of cream and count down those sessions it will soon be done :) All the best Louise xxx
Posts.Title: fatigue

Posts.Content: Hi Jacky, Just read your post today so hope you have managed to speak to one of the nurses on the Maccy line after Kates suggestion. I had saline expander on my left breast after Mx in March of last year. I had saline added during my initial surgery and then four weeks later an enormous amount of saline added into my recon in one go!!!. It was a bit of a shock firstly because a) the size and b) the strange weight on my chest. Not to mention the pain!! My surgeon told me the same thing that once I was ready ( 6 months later) we would discuss what we could do to " even up " my look. I have to say once I am in a bra or swimming costume you would never know the difference it is only when I am undressed that gravity works its magic on my right sided breast. I could look in the mirror and stand side view on and say I have the breast one side of a 20 year old and when I turn to the other side have the breast of my true 47 years. Its been a mental struggle to get used to it but I have found it doable. Please contact me for any further support or info. My very best wishes Louise x
Posts.Title: 1st saline expansion

Posts.Content: Hi there, so sorry to hear you have had such a reaction to your second FEC and I do hope that the extra time you have between treatments will give you lots of strength and a chance to recover. I am sure that your team will be looking at you as an individual and making the best judgements for your next FEC and then the Doxetaxel. You will know from reading all the different posts on the site that we all have so many different reactions and side effects to these medications and in some way i find this reassuring as we are all different and whilst some find one treatment difficult others find it not so bad. Try to talk to your team and let them know your worries especially with your weight many Macmillan units have dieticians that you can meet with too. Sounds like that would be helpful for you. I wish you lots of energy and good luck with the rest of your treatmentÂ  journey Louise x
Posts.Title: Moving from FEC to Docetaxel

Posts.Content: thank you for everyone who has replied to my post. I feel ready and know what to expect tomorrow. Margr are you allowed to eat and drink after your injection? Louise x
Posts.Title: bone scan

Posts.Content: Good luck for 2pm x
Posts.Title: bone scan

Posts.Content: Morning Chloecat45, your muscle pulling sounds painful glad it has eased. I hope all goes well with you MRI scan is that before Xmas? Please keep us updated. Much love xxx
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi Soorob, you must be very worried. I had a similar experience and I spoke to the team here at MacMillan and they were really helpful and gave me some wonderful advice. I am a widow and was six weeks into a new job in a new area.I was mortified and couldn't believe how unlucky I was to be diagnosed with BC. You will have a contract with your company you need to read it and see what their policy is for sick pay. This will be good information to have to hand when you phone the help line tomorrow. Do not worry all changes to your contract have to be put in writing and agreed by yourself. They can not introduce anything that only effects your working hours only as that would be discriminating against you. Let me know how you get on Good luck Louise x
Posts.Title: Sick pay

Posts.Content: Thank you I am diary in hand and off ASAP :)
Posts.Title: Amoena fitting service

Posts.Content: Thanks Alison all my purchase from them have been by mail but I have often wondered if a Visit would be worth the journey. And it sounds like it would be. Did you have access to some sales pieces As well as some of their stuff it a bit pricy don't get me wrong I think it's worth it but if I can buy 3 things in one go it makes all the difference Louise xx
Posts.Title: Amoena fitting service

Posts.Content: Hi Marg, Hope you can book another holiday soon :) Â
Posts.Title: moods

Posts.Content: HI Becklindsay9, I returned to my work 6 weeks ago and was signed back to work just 2 days per week to begin with I had a total of 8 months off. I spoke to my employer about a returned phase to work as I was not feeling well enough ( and my Dr agreed) to go back full time initially. It has been difficult to go back to work both emotionally and physically and I found that speaking to the support team workers on the Maccy help line were really helpful. They will help you with any discrimination factors. I wish you well with your return to work. Did you have rads too? Louise
Posts.Title: Returning to work

Posts.Content: Africa Queen I am so sorry to read your post and how dreadful for you and your mum too. I feel sure there is additional medication she could be taking which could help is it something you could discuss on the Macmillan help line number? Most hospitals have dieticians which can help with choosing the best suitable foods for your mum, there are also a Macmillan recipe book which may be helpful too. I do hope that by asking you get some additional help but by reducing fruit juices and increasing carbohydrates like potato, rice, bread should begin to help. Please seek out additional help and good luck xxx
Posts.Title: Chronic diahorea

Posts.Content: My goodness C i am not surprised you are stressed. Bless you. Mentally and emotionally returning to work is much harder than i thought it would be. I had been off longer than you have though. I think after my chemo (3 FEC 3 T) that my brain has almost like a fuzzy phase to it. Sometimes I say words that bear not resemblance to the word I was hoping to use.My boys think its very funny and have loved having me around at home before and after school. Well done to you for taking on distance learning at this time. I admire you x
Posts.Title: Returning to work

Posts.Content: Hi Susy great to hear how things are going I have thought of you often after your first post. Children are never ill at a convenient time are they. My son broke his toe the day I was discharged from hospital after my mx. Luckily I have great parents that helped nurse me and him at the same time ( I am a widow) I wish you a speedy recovery and glad to hear your faith has been restored they are some truly fantastic NHS staff out there! Louise x
Posts.Title: New diagnosis - Scared and loosing faith in the system fast

Posts.Content: Great to hear about your journey I am raising a lovey glass of wine to you
Posts.Title: Last chemo done, 3 x FEC and 3 x Taxatere. Done! finito!!

Posts.Content: Hi Mina, I am sorry you are feeling so horrible. I do agree with the previous posts about discussing it further with your onc but it can be very difficult to pick up the phone when you feel so dreadful. Do you have a partner or close friend who can help and phone on your behalf today and get you some additional meds/advise from your chemo nurses? Don't suffer unnecessarily as the teams are here to help us all on our journeys. Alternatively the nurses on the Maccy line are excellent with additional advise too. Hope you are feeling a bit more yourself really soon Louise xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling sick for 6 days post chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Flower Dragon ( lovely name) wishing you the very best for this weeks results. Please let us know how you get on. Are you down in Eastbourne? I work in Newhaven xxx
Posts.Title: First post

Posts.Content: Hi Becca, got the T shirt. Today I am keeping myself busy I have inflammatory breast cancer and every day something new is shite. The oral chemotherapy is making my big toe nails grow inwards, I have skin that is spotty, pain in my recon breast, aching limbs but do you know what. Today I am cooking fairy cakes for my teenage son to take to his 6 form class tomorrow, I have made ricotta and spinach cannelloni for dinner. I have cleaned the bathroom and washed the kitchen floor. In two days time it will be Valentines day and I will tell all the people I love what they mean to me cos I may not be here next year to celebrate. I have read your posts so often, you inspire me, how i wish i had the courage and determination to do the things you do and make peoples lives happy. Today may be shite but tomorrow is another day chin up chicken xxx
Posts.Title: Is cancer not enough?!

Posts.Content: Hi A, Sorry to hear your very recent news. You will have access and support from many others of people in a similar situation to yourself and hopefully it will make you feel more informed and not so alone. Its a terrible shock to both you and your mum I am sure. I welcome you to the website no one would really want to join, but are often glad that they did! Louise x
Posts.Title: MOM

Posts.Content: Hi Binny no I live in Bedford but work for a company in Newhaven and go there a couple of days per week. I do like the area very much and did intend to move when I was offered the job. Then I was diagnosed and decided to stay nearer my family and local hospital. However who knows what the future will bring ......... Much love xxxx
Posts.Title: First post

Posts.Content: Yes "chemo is my friend" that's what I used to chant to myself before my own chemo treatment and do you know what it was. My tumor showed a real shrinkage but I can be honest and say that there were days that I didn't believe that it would. I have inflammatory breast cancer and I could see the redness falling away from my breast at the chemotherapy treatment went on. Good luck chelsea64 with your up and coming treatment on Friday Kind regards Louise
Posts.Title: hi am new

Posts.Content: Hi I am a strong believer in listening to your body. Feeling hungry or thirsty we would feed and drink and its the same with tiredness - rest, sleep, put your feet up what ever is needed to recoup and recover. I promise the more you listen to your body now the quicker you will bet your energy back. Take it easy Louise xxx
Posts.Title: Tired

Posts.Content: Hi Nazia, I agree withÂ  the advise from the other postings. I am afraid my cancer did return whilst I was on herceptin but that doesn't mean that it will happen for your. Its important that we keep vigilant with our bodies after all we know them them the best. Let us know how you get on and best of luck Big hugs Louise x
Posts.Title: cud it be bk ?

Posts.Content: HI Mccaan, sorry you are feeling so lost at the moment. Things for me have never been the same since my diagnosis but that's not to say they are any worse just different. It does give you a chance to re-focus on whats important to you and your life. But i think you need to be at the right sort of place emotionally to be able to do that. Who can help you at this time, BC nurse?, Dr, I have spoken to the lovely nurses on this website for support at times too. Have you thought of local groups in your area that you could join, your hospital will be able to offer you the names ofÂ  support groups available in your area too. You could meet a new friend that way too. Ranting often makes you feel better why not embrace it knowing you will come out the other end feeling stronger and you are already an amazing personÂ  because you wouldn't have got this far without your own inner strength. Keep posting thinking of you Louise x
Posts.Title: Alone after treatment with no one

Posts.Content: I went to see the wig people on my birthday last January. I went with my sister and my youngest son who is known for his honesty!.Â  He photographed me with each of the wigs on until all three of us picked our favorite wig and at last we found one that we all agreed on. I had to put on a brave face through out it all who wants a wig in the first place and although it was a very nice one it reminded me how little hair I had and how ill i was. For me loosing my hair was really a hard thing to do, my two boys found it hard too. They much preferred it when I wore it so that I looked to them less unwell and more like my old self. Patricia you will get through this and its only a short period of your life as awful as it seems right now. Sometime hubbys understand and sometimes they don't but its important to you to express how you feel and you will feel better after a good cry and a scream I promise. Sending you a big hug Louise x
Posts.Title: emotions

Posts.Content: I asked the oncologist about weight gain and steroids. He said that some ladies and men gain weight as it makes them feel more hungry. I said if you can keep up a healthy diet and some comfortable exercise that was all you should be worrying about. :) take care xxx
Posts.Title: steroids?

Posts.Content: Hi Suze0, I haven not had thoracic surgery but do expect that will be part of my forth coming treatment after oral chemotherapy. I was re diagnosed with inflammatory breast cancer in September almost a year after my first diagnosis in 2012. I am expecting to complete 6 rounds of oral chemotherapy which will take me until the end of January 2014. Hopefully there is someone else who can talk from experience about thorasic surgery andÂ  I will learn something at the same time. All the best Louise
Posts.Title: Thoracic surgery for BC recurrence

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies, I was worried about having my 3rd and final taxotere and my herceptin treatment on the same day. In fact I did telephone a couple of days before to be sure that there hasn't been a mistake, I was assured that they often gave the two on the same day or a day apart. I would not say that I felt any worse than I had done previously whether it was the delight that it was the last one that helped me through I don't know. I hope all goes well in your ongoing treatments Louise x
Posts.Title: Taking longer to recover from 2nd cycle of docetaxel/cyclophospha...

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothy1, I did have what they expected was an infection in my mx scar with a week in hospital. Have they done a biopsy? Have you had an implant? It's really miserable and I think the antibiotics make you feel quite down. Keep up a great diet plenty of water and be kind to yourself with plenty of rest and sleep xxx
Posts.Title: Breast cancer complications

Posts.Content: Hi Patricia, you sound perfectly normal who wouldn't be scared, emotional and finding it hard to cope after thatÂ  diagnosis. Take a deep breath. I am sorry you find yourself here but you will get plenty of support and advise. Many of us ladies and gents have found ourselves with this diagnosis, but today breast cancer is very treatable and you will find hidden strength you didn't know you had to get you through this time. Try to keep yourself busy until Friday plan some enjoyable things to do. My recommendationÂ  would be to take your partner or a good friend with you on Friday who can take some notes for you during your consultation. I found that very helpful to re read later when I got home. Wishing you lots of kindness Louise
Posts.Title: coping with diagnosis

Posts.Content: Hi there I found ginger tea helped with the sickness and my taste changed and tea and coffee tasted strange. Plenty of water helps too. But listen to your body rest when you need to and if cooking or cleaning are too much for you ensure you have a few speedy meals on standby.Also accept any help offered around the house shopping etc. Be your own best friend and I wish you lots of luck xxx
Posts.Title: I am a Newby......and potential guinea pig!!!!!!!
